|population_density_km2 = 9.4 |population_density_sq_mi = 24.4 |elevation_m = |elevation_ft = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Taylor Township''' is a township in [[Centre County, Pennsylvania|Centre County]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. It is part of the [[State College, Pennsylvania|State College]], [[Pennsylvania]] [[Metropolitan Statistical Area]]. The population was 741 at the [[2000 United States Census|2000 census]]. ==Geography== According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the township has a total area of 30.4 square miles (78.8 km²), all of it land. Taylor Township is bordered by [[Rush Township, Centre County, Pennsylvania|Rush Township]] to the northwest, [[Worth Township, Centre County, Pennsylvania|Worth Township]] to the northeast, [[Halfmoon Township, Centre County, Pennsylvania|Halfmoon Township]] to the southeast and [[Blair County, Pennsylvania|Blair County]] to the southwest. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 741 people, 292 households, and 223 families residing in the township. The [[population density]] was 24.4 people per square mile (9.4/km²). There were 333 housing units at an average density of 10.9/sq mi (4.2/km²). The racial makeup of the township was 99.19% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 0.13% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.13% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], and 0.54% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 0.27% of the population. There were 292 households out of which 31.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 62.3% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 8.2% had a female householder with no husband present, and 23.3% were non-families. 18.8% of all households were made up of individuals and 6.2% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.53 and the average family size was 2.83. In the township the population was spread out with 22.3% under the age of 18, 8.0% from 18 to 24, 31.0% from 25 to 44, 27.9% from 45 to 64, and 10.8% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 38 years. For every 100 females there were 103.6 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 101.4 males. The median income for a household in the township was $40,192, and the median income for a family was $43,977. Males had a median income of $32,857 versus $25,313 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the township was $17,994. About 9.3% of families and 11.8% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 19.9% of those under age 18 and 12.0% of those age 65 or over. ==References== <references /> {{Centre County, Pennsylvania}} {{coord|40.79|-78.12|display=title}} [[Category:Populated places established in 1790]] [[Category:Townships in Centre County, Pennsylvania]]
